content.description:
This is the right most bolted line in the Valerie Book Area. it follows the blank steep face straight up. Just right of Tarzan. This thing is hard, don't expect a jack's canyon or flagstaff give me here. Consistent hard moves in the v5-6 range the whole way up with one decent rest at the bottom of the climb. 

  Could be Promised Lands hardest??
content.location: Right most route, just right of Tarzan 5.11a arete.

content.description: this route is the large left facing open book on the left side of the canyon.  climbs up an easy face to a tight hands/hand crack.  trad anchor at the top, and walk off the ramps. behind.  the crux is low and well protected.
content.protection: nuts and cams to a #2 or 3 bd.
content.location: about 15 minutes from the parking, on the left side up the hill.  it is the obvious left facing book approach 50 meters uphill from the sandy wash

content.description: Obvious arete with balancy and pumpy moves to the anchor.
Steep punchy climbing up a juggy thin-hands crack. Mantel onto the arete and finish on Good Beginner Lead clipping one bolt en route to the two-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Single set cams to 2" - optional doubles in the 1.25-1.5" range (green and red camalots)   Two-bolt anchor
content.location: This route starts in the steep black-streaked handcrack on the other (north) side of the arete from Good Beginner Lead.

content.description: Bolted climb to the right of Pizan. Starts in a crack system. Can place a #1 Camalot-sized piece in the crack before first bolt. Continue up very nice face past horizontals to ledge and penultimate bolt. Continue up (clip bolt on right), then left around arete to anchor shared with Pizan.

climbs.name: Second Wind
climbs.fa: unknown --- FRA: Derek Field & Jose Marmolejo (Feb 2018)

content.description:
This route ascends the string of broken incipient cracks on the face just left of First Light. It's not unsafe, but considering the grade, gear can be a little tricky in spots.

 Construct a gear anchor at the top. When you are done, walk 10 feet to climber's right and rappel First Light. Or walk off to climber's left.
content.location: Incipient cracks just left of First Light.

content.description: 80' Sport route. Left of Black Cleft
content.protection: 7 bolts up to a two bolt anchor. Or top roped if accessed from the back ramp.

content.description: Bolted climb immediately to the right of Valerie's book. Starts on somewhat ledgy terrain to first bolt at small overhang, onto ramp, then up face to the left of the arete to anchor.
Obvious finger crack to the left of Valerie's Book. Good crack starts about halfway up the wall.
content.protection: 25 feet or so to the first piece of pro but it is 5.easy climbing to that point. Nuts and/or cams to BD#1 (I used a BD#2 to protect the topout). Gear anchor if topping out.
content.location: Between Black Cleft and Valerie's Book

content.description:
Consider this a temporary descriptive name until someone comes forward with details.

 Climb the blocky right-leaning crack to a stance on the arete. Clip a bolt and face climb up to the two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Blocky crack just left of the outside arete on the fourth buttress to the left ofThe Prow. See photo for route identification.

climbs.name: First Light
climbs.fa: unknown --- FRA: Derek Field & Jose Marmolejo (Feb 2018); two-bolt anchor installed Sept 2019

content.description:
This is a pretty good crack+face climb with an exciting finish, making it a decent choice for budding trad leaders.

 Follow the stepped roofs up and right and pull the bulge into the crack above. Follow the crack up to the exciting finish: a short, airy roof crack. Two-bolt ring anchor on top.
content.protection: Double set cams to 3"   Two-bolt ring anchor
content.location: Obvious crack in the middle of the fourth buttress to the left of The Prow.

climbs.name: Ernie's Ladder
climbs.fa: unknown --- FRA: Derek Field & Jose Marmolejo (Feb 2018)

content.description:
Mediocre face climbing up a broken crack system.

 Construct a gear anchor at the top. When finished, walk 30 feet to climber's left and rappel Good Beginner Lead or First Light.
content.location: Obvious broken crack system on the third buttress to the left of The Prow. This route is across the gully from Sleeptalker.

content.description: Fun face climbing over and around two overhangs.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor at the top
content.location: Route is the bolted route to the left of Valerie's Book

content.description: This wall is in shade for the winter months, but during other seasons gets afternoon sun.  Most routes on this wall are moderate, 5.6-9+.
